keywords.name: Ethereal
keywords.description: If this card is in hand at the end of the turn, it is Exhausted.

keywords.name: Exhaust
keywords.description: When this card is played, remove this card from play for the rest of the game.

keywords.name: Innate
keywords.description: Start the game with this card in the opening hand.

keywords.name: Retain
keywords.description: Keep the card in hand at the end of the turn instead of discarding it.

keywords.name: Prepare X
keywords.description: Each turn, increase or reduce the Energy cost of this card by X until the card is used.

keywords.name: Evade
keywords.description: After Clash: If an Attack vs Defense clash would deal 0 Power damage after Shield, that Attack is not a hit. Reuse this card.

keywords.name: Reuse
keywords.description: After this card finishes a clash, do not discard it. Keep it in the current zone so it can be paired again during the same zone resolution.

keywords.name: Follow-Up
keywords.description: After Use: This card can be played after any other card from the same character.

keywords.name: Assist Attack
keywords.description: After Use: This card can be played after any other card used by a different character.

keywords.name: Resist X
keywords.description: When damage would be dealt to HP, reduce that damage by X after Shield is applied. X can be a flat value (example: Resist 5), a percentage (example: Resist 20%), or both (example: Resist 5/20%). If both are listed, calculate both and use the higher reduction. If damage types or attack tags are listed, Resist applies only to those; if multiple are listed, apply once when any match. Damage cannot go below 0.

keywords.name: Immune (Damage Type)
keywords.description: Damage of the specified type becomes 0 before Shield and HP. The attack still counts as a hit unless another effect says otherwise.

keywords.name: Weakness X
keywords.description: When damage would be dealt to HP, increase that damage by X after Shield is applied. X can be a flat value (example: Weakness 5), a percentage (example: Weakness 20%), or both (example: Weakness 5/20%). If both are listed, calculate both and use the higher increase. If damage types or attack tags are listed, Weakness applies only to those; if multiple are listed, apply once when any match.

keywords.name: Absorb X
keywords.description: When damage would be dealt to HP, reduce that damage by X after Shield is applied, then heal for the amount reduced. X can be a flat value (example: Absorb 5), a percentage (example: Absorb 20%), or both (example: Absorb 5/20%). If both are listed, calculate both and use the higher reduction. If damage types or attack tags are listed, Absorb applies only to those; if multiple are listed, apply once when any match. Damage cannot go below 0.

keywords.name: Bounce X
keywords.description: A random adjacent character to the main target will also take the effect. Repeat X times.
